song_title: You Never Give Me Your Money

lyrics.annotation:
Legal dealings with Apple and within the band were going nowhere. Lennon and Harrison favored the appointment of Rolling Stones manager Allen Klein as their new chief adviser after the death of Brian Epstein, whilst McCartney wanted his new brother-in-law. For a short time, both were appointed as co-managers, but in the end Klein won out.



Allen Klein, left, with John and Yoko.
lyrics: You never give me your money
You only give me your funny paper
And in the middle of negotiations
You break down
I never give you my number
I only give you my situation
And in the middle of investigation
I break down

lyrics.annotation: A “jobber” is a middleman who purchases large quantities of goods for resale.  It specifically refers to those who buy and resell fuel, but can be used for any middleman.
lyrics: Out of college, money spent
See no future, pay no rent
All the money's gone, nowhere to go
Any jobber got the sack
Monday morning, turning back
Yellow
lorry
slow, nowhere to go
But oh, that magic feeling, nowhere to go
Oh, that magic feeling, nowhere to go
Nowhere to go

lyrics.annotation:
McCartney accepting here that the future of the band together is now behind them. He creates the image of driving away from everything, leaving it behind. He sheds a tear, however, showing that it isn’t an easy thing to do for him.

Lennon announced that he was finished with the band in September 1969, so McCartney knew Abbey Road would be the last album the band ever made.
lyrics: One sweet dream
Pick up the bags, get in the limousine
Soon we'll be away from here
Step on the gas and wipe that tear away
One sweet dream came true today
Came true today
Came true today
Yes, it did

lyrics.annotation:
A children’s rhyme, possibly symbolising a new life and new beginnings for the band’s members.

Charles Manson, who famously interpreted Beatles lyrics as satanic messages, scrawled this lyric on the Manson family front door.
lyrics: One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven
All good children go to Heaven
